DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this pilot study is to evaluate the effect of auricular autonomous nervous system stimulation on vital parameters of wound healing in diabetics. It is investigated if auricular vagal nerve stimulation has an effect on heart rate variability as well as peripheral local blood perfusion, and if this effect depends on the health status of the study participants (diseased/healthy).
DOC.brief_title: Pilot Study on Auricular Vagus Nerve Stimulation Effects in Chronic Diabetic Wounds
DOC.criteria: diabetes mellitus type 2 ulcus cruris (plantar) min. 6 weeks of standard wound therapy without success intact big toe on wound side participation in a clinical trial in the last 5 weeks confounding medical treatment, e.g. prostaglandin vascular diseases other than peripheral arterial occlusive disease diseases which may affect the autonomous nervous system or wound healing, except diabetic concomitant diseases (e.g., polyneuropathy, angiopathy) drug abuse active implanted devices pregnancy or nursing
DOC.keyword: vagus nerve stimulation effects on heart rate variability and peripheral blood perfusion
